posts.post_content:
Looking for the front/back combinations listed below. These are for my [URL="http://imageevent.com/ineedanap/t206;jsessionid=dwdebnln51.tiger_s"]Lajoie collection[/URL], so I have no plans to flip these on the B/S/T or eBay three months after getting them. Am happy to purchase or trade in your favor. I've got a lot of prewar Hall of Famers and uncommon type cards -- in nice shape -- to trade. Hope to hear from you.

Thanks,

Rob

wolfie51sb at aol.com

BATTING

Black Lenox

Piedmont 350-460 Factory 42

Sweet Cap. 350 Fact. 25 (might or might not exist; figured I'd list it)

THROWING

Hindu

Old Mill

Sovereign 350

Sweet Caporal 350 Factory 25 (might or might not exist; figured I'd list it)

PORTRAIT

Old Mill

Sweet Caporal 150 Factory 25

Sweet Caporal 350 Factory 25

First, shouldn't a solicitation such as yours begin with a brief summarry of how long you've been collecting? Then it needs to blend into a recap of how well known you are, how powerful your collection is, and how we are all pip-squeaks in your mind. 

Writing the way you do, it's no wonder you get nothing done! 

I just checked mine and they are all ordinary, pedestrian, cards, with common backs, which would be unworthy in your hands. 

Sorry.


(Oh..., and Bump.)

[quote name="Jim VB" post=874602]First, shouldn't a solicitation such as yours begin with a brief summarry of how long you've been collecting? Then it needs to blend into a recap of how well known you are, how powerful your collection is, and how we are all pip-squeaks in your mind. 

Writing the way you do, it's no wonder you get nothing done! 

I just checked mine and they are all ordinary, pedestrian, cards, with common backs, which would be unworthy in your hands. 

Sorry.


(Oh..., and Bump.)[/QUOTE]

You really miss him/them.

[quote name="freakhappy" post=874639]Nice collection of Nap's!

Mike[/QUOTE]

Thanks for the kind words, Mike.

[quote name="Rob D." post=874664]You really miss him/them.[/QUOTE]

Whilst you sit in the middle of cow town USA, we have no idea who you are talking about!

[quote name="Peter_Spaeth" post=874714]Isn't "might or might not" redundant?  :confused::confused::D:D[/QUOTE]

You see it a lot in print, so it has become accepted.
